# Payroll Variance Monitor

A React-based tool for monitoring month-to-month variations in payroll data. Upload multiple Excel payroll files and automatically detect significant changes that require review.

## Features

- üìä **Multi-file Upload**: Upload unlimited payroll files (.xls, .xlsx)
- üö® **Smart Alerts**: Automatically flag significant variances above your threshold
- üë• **Employee Tracking**: Monitor individual employee changes
- üìà **Company Metrics**: Track organization-wide payroll trends
- ‚öôÔ∏è **Configurable Thresholds**: Set sensitivity from 10% to 25%
- üí∞ **Multiple Metrics**: Monitor salary, allowances, overtime, gross pay, net wages, and taxes

## Key Metrics Monitored

- **Total Salary** changes
- **Allowances (Add)** variations
- **Overtime Amount** fluctuations
- **Gross Pay** differences
- **Net Wages** changes
- **Tax (PCB)** variations
- **Employee count** changes

## Alert Types

- üö® **High Priority**: Major variances (‚â•25% or ‚â•50% for individuals)
- ‚ö†Ô∏è **Medium Priority**: Moderate variances above your threshold
- üë§ **Employee-Level**: Individual salary/allowance changes
- üë• **Headcount**: Staff additions/departures
- üè¢ **Company-Wide**: Organization-level changes

## Usage

1. **Upload Files**: Select multiple monthly payroll Excel files
2. **Set Threshold**: Choose your sensitivity level (10-25%)
3. **Review Alerts**: Check flagged items for manual review
4. **Ongoing Monitoring**: Add new months as they become available

## Supported File Formats

- Excel files (.xls, .xlsx)
- Range Pharma payroll format
- Automatic month detection from file content or filename

## Development

```bash
# Install dependencies
npm install

# Start development server
npm start

# Build for production
npm run build

# Deploy to GitHub Pages
npm run deploy
```

## Technology Stack

- **React 18** - UI framework
- **Tailwind CSS** - Styling
- **Lucide React** - Icons
- **SheetJS** - Excel file processing
- **GitHub Pages** - Deployment

## Security Note

All file processing happens locally in your browser. No payroll data is sent to any server or stored online.

.github/workflows/deploy.yml:
name: Deploy to GitHub Pages

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]

jobs:
  deploy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    permissions:
      contents: read
      pages: write
      id-token: write
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
    - name: Setup Node.js
      uses: actions/setup-node@v4
      with:
        node-version: '18'
        cache: 'npm'
        
    - name: Install dependencies
      run: npm ci
      
    - name: Build
      run: npm run build
      
    - name: Setup Pages
      uses: actions/configure-pages@v4
      
    - name: Upload artifact
      uses: actions/upload-pages-artifact@v3
      with:
        path: './build'
        
    - name: Deploy to GitHub Pages
      id: deployment
      uses: actions/deploy-pages@v4
